title: Microsoft To Do: Lists & Tasks
description: Microsoft To Do is a task management app to help you stay organized and manage your day-to-day. You can use Microsoft To Do to make shopping lists or task lists, take notes, record collections, plan an event, or set reminders to increase your productivity and focus on what matters to you. Microsoft To Do makes it easy to stay organized and manage your life. Accomplish what's meaningful and important to you each day with My Day and Suggestions, your personalized daily planner tools. Intelligent suggestions recommend tasks from across your lists that may be relevant for the day. From grocery lists to housecleaning routines, daily tasks are simple with To Do. When you're quickly switching between contexts and tasks, it's important to have tools that help you achieve what matters. Microsoft To Do helps you quickly capture and retrieve your lists and tasks across devices and between multiple accounts. Capture tasks from different Microsoft apps and services and sync them with Microsoft To Do. Flag emails as tasks in Outlook or any email account hosted by Microsoft, add to lists with Cortana, and see tasks assigned to you from Microsoft Planner. Get peace of mind knowing that your tasks and lists are hosted on the Microsoft 365 service – one of the most reliable services with industry-leading security offerings. Microsoft To Do’s modern, easy-to-use experience makes your lists unique, with customizable features like emoji in lists, colorful themes, dark mode, and more. Plus, shared lists help you stay connected and collaborate with family, friends, and colleagues. Microsoft To Do features: Daily planner • A daily planner personalized with suggested tasks: My Day • To do lists are accessible anywhere, on any device • Share lists and assign tasks with your friends, family, colleagues, and classmates • Task management features break your tasks into manageable steps • Take notes to add to any task • Group lists together by topic or project Task manager • Add reminders, tasks and lists with the To Do widget • Daily organizer personalized with bold and colorful backgrounds • Reminders with one-time or recurring due dates • Make task lists and switch between school, work, and personal lists • Attach up to 25 MB of files to any task To Do lists for any purpose • Bill planner • Shopping list • Reminders • Task management • Take notes • And more Office 365 integration • Sync reminders and task lists between Outlook and To Do • Lists and tasks are hosted with the security of Microsoft 365 • Task lists are compiled from the apps and services across Microsoft 365 • Add multiple Microsoft accounts Microsoft To Do helps you organize and simplify your plans, whether it's for work, school, or home. To Do is free and available across the web and iOS, Mac, Android, and Windows devices. Learn more: https://to-do.microsoft.com Follow us on Twitter: @MicrosoftToDo Need support? https://todosupport.microsoft.com/support?product_id=todo By installing Microsoft To Do, you agree to the Microsoft Terms of Use: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842575
descriptionHTML:
Microsoft To Do is a task management app to help you stay organized and manage your day-to-day. You can use Microsoft To Do to make shopping lists or task lists, take notes, record collections, plan an event, or set reminders to increase your productivity and focus on what matters to you. Microsoft To Do makes it easy to stay organized and manage your life.

Accomplish what's meaningful and important to you each day with My Day and Suggestions, your personalized daily planner tools. Intelligent suggestions recommend tasks from across your lists that may be relevant for the day. From grocery lists to housecleaning routines, daily tasks are simple with To Do. When you're quickly switching between contexts and tasks, it's important to have tools that help you achieve what matters. Microsoft To Do helps you quickly capture and retrieve your lists and tasks across devices and between multiple accounts.

Capture tasks from different Microsoft apps and services and sync them with Microsoft To Do. Flag emails as tasks in Outlook or any email account hosted by Microsoft, add to lists with Cortana, and see tasks assigned to you from Microsoft Planner. Get peace of mind knowing that your tasks and lists are hosted on the Microsoft 365 service – one of the most reliable services with industry-leading security offerings.

Microsoft To Do’s modern, easy-to-use experience makes your lists unique, with customizable features like emoji in lists, colorful themes, dark mode, and more. Plus, shared lists help you stay connected and collaborate with family, friends, and colleagues.

Microsoft To Do features:

Daily planner
• A daily planner personalized with suggested tasks: My Day
• To do lists are accessible anywhere, on any device
• Share lists and assign tasks with your friends, family, colleagues, and classmates
• Task management features break your tasks into manageable steps
• Take notes to add to any task
• Group lists together by topic or project

Task manager
• Add reminders, tasks and lists with the To Do widget
• Daily organizer personalized with bold and colorful backgrounds
• Reminders with one-time or recurring due dates
• Make task lists and switch between school, work, and personal lists
• Attach up to 25 MB of files to any task

To Do lists for any purpose
• Bill planner
• Shopping list
• Reminders
• Task management
• Take notes
• And more

Office 365 integration
• Sync reminders and task lists between Outlook and To Do
• Lists and tasks are hosted with the security of Microsoft 365
• Task lists are compiled from the apps and services across Microsoft 365
• Add multiple Microsoft accounts

Microsoft To Do helps you organize and simplify your plans, whether it's for work, school, or home.

To Do is free and available across the web and iOS, Mac, Android, and Windows devices.

Learn more: https://to-do.microsoft.com
Follow us on Twitter: @MicrosoftToDo
Need support? https://todosupport.microsoft.com/support?product_id=todo
By installing Microsoft To Do, you agree to the Microsoft Terms of Use: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842575
summary: Increase productivity! Make a daily to do list, create a reminder & share notes!

scraped_reviews.content: I enjoy Microsoft To Do, it works well with the way my brain works. I've started using it in place of not only a to do app, but also Google Keep. I do wish there were a few more features like multiple reminders, custom reminders, and reminders on sub-tasks. But, I've found work-around which in some ways are better, which is why I think I've stuck with this app more happily than previous to do apps.

I do everything in this. lists for movies, leaving town checklist, groceries, Costco, doctor visits, Xmas lists.... it does it all. Groceries are great because you tend to get the same food items. Just check or uncheck the items you need. you can invite someone else to share your list, so if your partner ends up at the store, you could add items from home and they get it immediately. it's the best list organizer I've ever used.

Currently has a bug: not properly syncing across devices, particularly order of things; all out of order on other devices (3 phones + laptop, all different). Very frustrating! Other than that, quite good. Simple, pretty, usually does what it should. Key frustration: how long it takes to drag items to reorder. I wish there was a way of dragging multiple items. I also wish lists could have internal subheadings.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Sandra! Thanks for your feedback. We currently don't have a feature where you can add a task in-between other tasks. You can actually sort tasks inside To Do lists in many different ways. Do give it a try :) Regards, The To Do Team

scraped_reviews.content: I generally really like this app, but recently I've had an issue with a pop up that opens every time I open the app. It is telling me I don't have notifications enabled, and I don't want notifications enabled, so I hit dismiss, but it pops up literally every single time I open the app, which is very frequently in a day. I cannot find a way to contact support for this on the app or on Microsoft's website. I sent an email to the address listed on here but it came back as undeliverable.

Almost perfect, I like To Do for work and its excellent for getting reminders through on my work PC and keeping track of things on the help desk but the mobile app keeps telling me I have notifications disabled. I just use the mobile app to put reminders in place when I haven't had time during work hours. My notifications are off intentionally so I'm not getting reminders while I'm off the clock. If I could opt out of these reminders to enable notifs, that would be great.

If you’re using Microsoft 365, this tool is a game-changer. I didn’t really know how to use it effectively until I took a class and explored resources from Crucial Learning’s Getting Things Done (GTD). It introduced me to practical tips and tricks for integrating my email, calendar, and other Microsoft 365 apps. Since then, it has been incredibly helpful in keeping me organized both at work and at home.

Pros: I like that it syncs data to my Windows laptop, and that there's a web view for other environments. I also really like that it works with Outlook to track flagged emails. Aesthetically I would describe it as "fine". Cons: recurring tasks are clunky, and there's a bug that's marking them as checked off even when I have not indicated that the task is done. This is *the whole point* of this app, and it cannot do it reliably. For that reason, I must give it a poor rating.

I think Microsoft To-Do is one of the better applications out there. I do think from an tracking standpoint, adding more Outlook and project like features would help tremendously. For example, if a task goes "unchecked" where I can find my "overdue" items? You can't. Another example, if I want to copy the subtasks into another new task, you can't do that. Another example, if I want to group tasks that are dependent on each other for completion, you can't. So much potential!

For a little over a week, I've been experiencing a bug where every time I create a new to-do/item in a list, the little icon pops up indicating there's a note in the item, even though there never is. I've even tried adding and removing a note to see if it goes away, and it doesn't make any difference. Not a huge deal, but it takes up space on my screen and makes it harder to find list items that do actually have notes, so it's been fairly annoying.

OMG!! They BROKE what was a very good app! Completed "tasks" can no longer be sorted which makes this app USELESS. We mostly use this app for shopping lists with hundreds of items on the list, mostly in the completed section. When we again need the item, we just uncheck it. When these items were listed alphabetically they were easy to find. Now they are in random order and impossible to find. WOW

Microsoft To do has the basics but lacks the necessary automation and QoL features that other apps have. For example, syncing with smart home devices, sharing to other Todo apps in case of company policies, setting repeat occurrences for a set amount of times, etc. Some features would be easy to add but there hasn't been any substantial update to the app for years. Overall, seek an alternative unless you can settle with only Microsoft syncing and lackluster QoL.

Just not far enough along to be really useful. It did pull tasks from different accounts (personal, work, school) but there is no way to come up with a consolidated list to work from for the day. Subtasks (steps) don't have the ability to show up separately on a day so you can't use it to plan out complicated tasks. Tasks don't have a due time assignable so useless as a homework tracker. No geo-fencing. Ever since they gutted Outlook I been relying more and more on paper day-timer.

I switched to this app from Wunderlist and was pleased to find that you can sort a list (completed and incomplete) alphabetically. However, this feature just been downgraded so that now the completed tasks can no longer be sorted! I'm so disappointed! Why did they make this change!? I'm so frustrated. It takes forever to make my grocery list now.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience and are working on this issue. Do let us know if you have any other feedback or suggestions, by writing to us at todofeedback@microsoft.com. We would love to hear from you!

scraped_reviews.content: Microsoft forces you to use your Microsoft account to use it, then never keeps you logged in long enough to get notifications. Sharing via text feels like I'm back on my Droid phone, and trying to get updates to shared lists suffers from the forced log outs as well. Also can't customize "smart lists" that are stuck at the top. My Day and Tasks? That's the same thing for me, either let me put it at the bottom or let me remove them. Microsoft took Wunderlist and ruined it.

Tried this out after the Wunderlist team was purchased by Microsoft and are pushing it on us in-app in Wunderlist. Unfortunately, it seems to have some bugs, particularly when list sharing with other people. Getting lots of errors and pop-up dialog boxes trying to share lists with others, possibly related to how long it takes when "getting a list ready" after sharing. Had to logout and clear storage a few times to get it setup. Going to compare with Remember The Milk (RTM) and report back.

I love this app, I use it for everything! I do have one suggestion, but it's not important enough for me to dock stars haha. Since you can due dates for tasks, I think it would be cool/ easier to use if there were a calendar section (that looks like a traditional calendar) so you can see all your tasks all at once instead of scrolling through them.

The hardest thing to do (pun unintended) was to get into the habit of checking my To Do list everyday. I'd write down things but would not add a reminder, and so, it was useless. After some serious commitment, I started putting down things as soon as they came up, and would also add a reminder. Today, I finally am using this app to my advantage and it has helped be more responsible. I never miss an appointment or something important I have to do.

Would love to be able to sync to the calendar and pre-configure my day ahead of time. Other than that, I love the app and how it connects/syncs to the computer. It has helped me immensely in keeping track of my life, making sure I don't leave anything behind. I really appreciate being able to add quick tasks and being able to set reminders for myself.

My wife and I used Wonderlist for years to share grocery lists, to-do's, packing lists, etc. The transition into Microsoft To Do could not have been more painful. Duplicate imports and no sharing between work/personal accounts made the move harder than it should be. But the most frustrating thing? I can no longer click and drag to order items in a list!! I be in the grocery store runnin around like a psycho cuz my list be all scrambled. And that's before I even look for toilet paper.

Can I give it ZERO stars?? It doesn't really work. If I can get in, (the "sign in" button doesn't work half the time) I can't assign any tasks. I sent the invite links, but they do not work for the ones I invite. The app is useless to me if I can't get the invites to sync up with me- How else can anyone see what needs to be done??? uugghh frustrated! Emailed support, never heard from them.

I don't want notifications. But every single time I open the app, as for example, to add milk to a grocery list, the app sends a pop-up "you haven't set up notifications in settings". Exactly right! But every addition to my list sparks this pop-up. Over and over and over again. Annoying. Am looking for a non-annoying to-do list.

Since last update, app is unusable. Stuck in loop requiring me to sign in to one of my two accounts. If I'm in one account it immediately requires me to sign in to the other. I can't even use the feedback function. Otherwise, a great app. I've been using it for years, I would use it all the time if it was functional. I guess there are alternatives out there though.

Update: Been using this for over a year now and I'm to the point of finding something new.  The fact that notifications don't clear when they are no longer relevant to the timing of the task is maddening.  When tasks are updated with future dates, there's no reason a past notification should be hanging around.    Nice simple interface.  The web interface seems to have some sync problems.  I put in a bunch of to-do's with my Edge browser, but not all made it to my phone.  Turns out, they didn't even upload to the servers.  It was stuck in my browser, so when I closed that, all the to-do's were lost.  Then, when I get a reminder on my phone, I adjust the reminder to a later time, but the notification doesn't clear.  Clearing the notification for a reminder that hasn't occurred yet should be automatic.

I really love the simple UI and the rewarding sound it makes when you check off something done. My only complaint is you can't choose the default view when you open the app. I use the 'To-Do' list part mostly and would like to have the option to just see the 'To-Do' list view only when I open the app versus 'My Day' first. I haven't found anything else comparable or better, but if possible would like that feature next update.

It used to be perfect, and then they went and screwed it all up. You can no longer turn on/off showing completed tasks, it just shows them, but at the bottom. And completed tasks don't sort based on what you select for sorting, so good luck finding something on a long list. Sadly, I'm back to searching for a functional list app because this one is no longer usable.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review, the issue is already fixed in Beta, you should see the fix in 2.18, you can join this group from Google Play. Alternatively, this fix will be released to a wider audience next week. We apologise for the inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: Horrible, horrible experience - learned my lesson the painful way, Microsoft products are so unreliable I can never again rely on them. How can you rely on software that breaks just when needed most? And breaks as in simply can't access at all, data all locked up, but can't open the app no matter how much you uninstall/reinstall. No thanks, I'm done.

I've been using Wunderlist, finally downloaded this to switch. I went to use my info from there, it says it's linked to a Microsoft account, so I go to sign in using that. I sign in just fine but it takes me to my Microsoft account page, no way to actually use the app. Closing it just means I have to sign in again, and back to the account page. I absolutely can't find a way to get to the app/it's features from this page. Beyond frustrating.

A Horrible upgrade! Its predecessor, Wunderlist, was a very useful tool. I could easily add new tasks and speak them by pressing one button. Now you have to go through a variety of clicks to do the same. Wunderlist easily and seamlessly integrated into my different operating platforms. Unfortunately, to do list requires that you use Windows 10 which I do not have and refuse to upgrade from Windows 8.1 Pro. There are other lists out there that you may want to consider.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Dear Jaye,
Could you please contact us via todofeedback@microsoft.com? We'd love to hear more about this issue in order to assist you. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: Edit: originally 3/5 because it is a nice app with one major flaw. Microsoft commented on my original review saying to contact customer service via email I did and they told me to look at one setting but my phone doesn't have that setting. They responded back basically "o well. That's all we got" and said it's my phone's fault. Like really? Piss poor support. Especially considering the app works fine for an extended period but then will stop. Can't be the setting they recommended.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Kevin,
Sorry for the inconvenience!
Please be assure that we are aware of the reminder issue you are facing. At first it appears that it can be because of OS limitations, however support engineers will analyze it further.
You will soon receive a reply from support team on next working day. Thanks for your patience!

scraped_reviews.content: I don't know where this app has been my entire life but I can't go without it now. I had paid for a different to do list app and it was absolutely terrible. There wasn't an option to set reminders, no due dates, no repeating events. It was a complete mess and I'd get so overwhelmed by it that I wouldn't get much accomplished, paper and pen would have been better. However, this app has been my ultimate life saver for my crazy busy life. It's so easy to use and isn't sloppy. You can add a task straight from your notification bar (s7 edge) if you enable that in your settings. I love not having to check it constantly throughout the day because I set a customized reminder with the task. I have this on my phone (primary use) and my computer, they sync without a single issue. My only complaint about this app is I personally don't need the "Important" list and there isn't an option to delete it.

For someone with ADHD who forgets things constantly (minute by minute), having an app that syncs across any device I want (PC, phone, work computer, etc) is a huge benefit. Think of some random thing I want to do? Add it on the phone, and then I can see it when I go to my PC next. It's a pretty darn good free app. It syncs with Outlook, too, for those of us who use it for work or whatever.

I use for many reminders, some weekly, some monthly, even some yearly. I love the ability to organize tasks into folders and set recurring reminders. Lately, reminders have been hit or miss, often not going off. I hope this is fixed soon. I also just had a big scare where many of my recurring tasks disappeared, but they returned after I updated. I would still recommend this app... but don't rely on it too heavily.

I've been using this app for at least 4 or 5 years now (when it was Wunderlist and now as Microsoft To Do). I use it constantly for weekly lists, groceries, and it has been wonderful for keeping track of odds and ends over time like books I want to read, music to listen to, etc. I like that you can attach documents. Only downside is I wish I could customize it more with different color schemes. Overall, very user-friendly.

Fine until recent update. It was a perfectly serviceable app for to do lists until it recently started popping up alerts every day saying, "What will you do today?" This interrupts work, music, podcasts, and actually takes away from productivity because I pick up my phone to see if it's an actual alert. I don't seem to be able to get rid of this without turning off all notifications, which would invalidate using a To do list app at all. Totally unnecessary.

Excellent potential, but very slow to get up to speed on essentials (at least to me) for task managers. Main impediment: you cannot set up a recurring task to start again from the date completed (as opposed to always cycling off of the first due date). For example, I may want a reminder to clean my cat's litter box every month -- but if I don't complete it until week 5 (sorry, cat!), the next reminder pops up in 3 weeks, instead of in a month, when it's actually needed again.

A bit more innovative than similar apps I've used. The fact that it integrates automatically with outlook is icing on the cake. The only suggestions I can think of right now would be to add more customization options for colors, especially. A color mixer is at the top of my wish list. But the bottom-line is that I had no problems getting up-to-speed after a couple of hours of random use. The app doesn't crash, supports floating windows; well-done.

I switched over to Microsoft to do after being notified that Wunderlist would not be available. With the most recent update to the app, the 'planned' list now only shows a filtered view. And I have to group it by date to even see it for each day. Previously I could see everything at once -by due date even overdue items. I can appreciate that everyone might not want to see everything. There should be an 'all' option if you are going to limit this. Looks like I get to find a new app.

If you share a list with someone, it hardly ever syncs between users. My wife and I tried to use this for a grocery list after Microsoft killed Wunderlist. The horrible syncing means if someone adds an item to the list, the other person won't see it when they are at the store. Also, Wunderlist was so easy to add a person and share a list. It's a total PITA to share a list now. You basically have to send an invite through text or emai, then you need to log in using a Microsoft account.

Covers the basics of a todo app and hasn't crashed. Has a nice feature of the flagged email however for in box zero folks like me, not that big of deal. One glaring omission is the ability to send an email to your task list. Also, it is crazy to me that they have notes but it doesnt utilize onenote! They have a perfect integration advantage that they aren't leveraging.

Best app by far for to-do lists and i have tried many. Very clean, simple, uncluttered. I especially like the My Day feature that makes it easy to get focused upon the most important things to do each day. I now use this app exclusively for to-do lists as well as other lists (goals, shopping, routines, conversations, media to watch/read/listen, etc.) which each get their own list group. There are a lot of good to-do/list apps out there but this one is great and I highly recommend it.

If you like Wunderlist, you should try this instead. Seems more logically organized, and I don't need to confirm every deletion in this app! I'd like to have the option for location based reminders like I can do in Cortana. So, it can remind me to stop for groceries when I leave the office, for example. Then maybe allow using both spatial and temporal reminders together!

There are few expectations out of a To Do app - operation and be everywhere. This app does that perfectly. I never had any hiccups regarding it not syncing on time or anything of that sort. I love the fact that it works on so many platforms smoothly - Outlook, smart phone, laptops.. Plus, it's has a great UI, simple thoughtful, yet options and settings to do nearly everything. And if you use it for work, you can create group and then lists. Microsoft, at least you got something right!

I've used this app for quite some time with very few issues. When everything is working as it should be, it's a great app! However, since 02/06/2021 I've been unable to sync any of my shared lists. I cleared the app cache, signed out and back in again, and uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Despite these attempts to rectify the problem, I still cannot sync shared lists.

Best to-do so far. Created by Microsoft, it has all the reliable things you would expect from them. One feature that I heard is coming, but has not arrived yet is the organization of stacked lists (lists inside lists, etc.). They keep it running nicely and update frequently. If you need to organize your life or if you have a job that requires a lot of tasks to complete, this is the app for you.

This app WAS AMAZING & it once replaced all others that I used for productivity until the "notes" section began a horrible glitch. While typing, it scrolls so you cannot effectively continue to to read, or edit anything that is written. As an event planner, I literally use digital notes to keep track of EVERYTHING. This is extremely disappointing, but looks like I was correct in considering transferring all of my data to another app over the past few months!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Trese, we are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. There is a compatibility bug with our notes editor on select Samsung devices and we are working on fixing it. In the meantime, it would be really lovely if you could switch to the Google keyboard so you can continue to use To Do without any glitches. Warm regards, To Do team

scraped_reviews.content: Someone thought it was a good idea to add a "feature" that asks me "what i plan to do today?" EVERY. DAY. You can turn it off if you can find the option buried somewhere. I dont need a reminder app to suddenly start reminding me to set up reminders. Seriously who though this was a good idea to add? UPDATE: You can turn off the daily reminder BUT IT WILL TURN ITSELF BACK ON. Also, WHY do I need a Microsoft account? What if I dont want to sync reminders to anything outside my phone? So bad!

Sbasically does what you want it to. However you will get notifications everyday. Even after you go into settings and turn them off. the next day you still get notifications and you see in the settings that the notification setting that you turned off is turned back on. Have been doing this every day and nothing changes. so you will be stuck getting notifications you don't want everyday. They are hell-bent on making sure this app gives you notifications no matter what your choice. That is wrong.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Ted,
Sorry for the inconvenience caused. We have resolved the issue with Daily planning reminder, you can now turn it OFF from settings. Do let us know if you need any help at todohelp@microsoft.com. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: Came over from Wunderlist. Quite disappointing how many things don't work consistently or don't work at all. Shared lists are wildly inconsistent at syncing properly. I think using the website version of the app might throw things off. Overall, shared lists don't work consistently. You can set up recurring or custom tasks to repeat on certain days, but recurring reminders is again wildly inconsistent. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Also no folders for lists. Needs improvement

I started using this app after Microsoft bought out Wunderlist (my old to-do app, which I still miss), and for a while everything was fine... but more recently, I'm no longer able to add more than one account. The option to add another account still appears, but doesn't seem to work. This is a huge inconvenience to me, as I used to rely heavily on being able to access multiple accounts. I'm afraid to try logging out of my main account, for fear that the app won't let me log back in. D:

After 8 hours, the sync with Wunderlist mysteriously completed. It's still not the app I'm looking for. Does not support RFC2822 compliant email addresses with plus signs. "Unable to sync", imported about half of my Wunderlist data, now the Android app thinks it's no longer connected to the internet. Web app reports "Something went wrong" while trying to import from Wunderlist. Does not appear to be a useful "List" app, only focusing on ToDo items. Not a good replacement for Wunderlist.

title: Southwest Airlines: Travel App
description:
The Southwest® app lets you easily book flights, hotels, cars, cruises, or vacation packages. You can quickly book your trip, check in, change or cancel flights, and add extras like EarlyBird Check-In® or Upgraded Boarding. The app also shows your gate information, boarding position, flight status, and more in the “My Trips” tab. Enjoy a seamless travel experience from planning a trip to last-minute flights.

Download the Southwest app today to book your next flight or hotel.

SOUTHWEST APP FEATURES:

BOOK A FLIGHT 
- Travel with ease as you search, book, and manage your flight 
- View your gate information, boarding position, flight status, and more in the “My Trips” tab
- Redeem your Rapid Rewards® points1 for qualifying Southwest purchases and flights
1All Rapid Rewards rules and regulations apply and can be found at Southwest.com/rrterms.

FIND YOUR HOTEL BOOKING THROUGH THE SOUTHWEST APP
- Open up your world to more travel experiences with each hotel booking
- Check into your hotel via the Southwest app
- Manage your reservation and find hotel deals
- Earn Rapid Rewards points1 for each hotel booking

BOARDING PASS ON THE GO
- Mobile boarding passes for all Passengers on your trip 24 hours in advance
- Flight Number, Confirmation Number, Boarding Time, Tier Status, and TSA PreCheck® details found in one place
- Save your Mobile Boarding Passes to Google Wallet for convenience

NEW - GETAWAYS BY SOUTHWESTTM
-Book your entire vacation package—flight, hotel, rental car—all in one place. It’s our most flexible way to vacay
- It’s never been easier to get away. Cancel or make changes to your package up to 10 minutes prior to your first departure*
-Use the in-app booking widget to search vacation packages in 30+ popular destinations like Las Vegas, Orlando, Hawaii, Cancun, Punta Cana, and Montego Bay

*Cancel/change 10 min before sched. depart. or funds forfeited. Price diff. & penalties may apply w/in 72 hrs. Add’l terms may apply. Terms can be found at Southwest.com/vacations/terms-and-conditions/

MORE WAYS TO PAY FOR YOUR FLIGHT
- Choose from multiple payment methods, including PayPal®, Flex Pay, credit/debit cards, and Southwest LUV Vouchers®
- Easily apply unused flight credits and gift cards when booking or changing your flight. You can find available credits in ‘My Account’ under the ‘Travel Funds’ section.

ACCESS INFLIGHT INFORMATION
Use the app to take you to our Inflight Entertainment Portal2, where you can watch free live TV3, access free on-demand TV episodes, and view free movies.

2Available only on WiFi-enabled aircraft. Limited time offer. Where available.
3Due to licensing restrictions, on WiFi-enabled international flights and free live TV may not be available for the full duration of the flight.

LIVE CHAT SUPPORT
Contact our Customer Representatives over Live Chat through our Help Center found in the “More” tab


AIRPORT PICKUP AND DROP-OFF
Seamlessly find transportation from the airport to your hotel. Thanks to our partnership with Lyft®, you can now use the app to help you request a Lyft®! You’ll know key information like estimated time of arrival and estimated price before booking. More of a rental car person? You can do that in the app, too.


EARN RAPID REWARDS POINTS WHEN YOU TRAVEL
Sign up for Rapid Rewards and earn points on your flights. Did you forget to add your Rapid Rewards number during booking?–No worries, add it after booking your flight and earn points1.


Book a flight, schedule pickups and drop-offs, enjoy fast and easy hotel booking, and embrace last-minute flights for your next spontaneous vacation–all with Southwest.
descriptionHTML:
The Southwest® app lets you easily book flights, hotels, cars, cruises, or vacation packages. You can quickly book your trip, check in, change or cancel flights, and add extras like EarlyBird Check-In® or Upgraded Boarding. The app also shows your gate information, boarding position, flight status, and more in the “My Trips” tab. Enjoy a seamless travel experience from planning a trip to last-minute flights.

Download the Southwest app today to book your next flight or hotel.

SOUTHWEST APP FEATURES:

BOOK A FLIGHT
- Travel with ease as you search, book, and manage your flight
- View your gate information, boarding position, flight status, and more in the “My Trips” tab
- Redeem your Rapid Rewards® points1 for qualifying Southwest purchases and flights
1All Rapid Rewards rules and regulations apply and can be found at Southwest.com/rrterms.

FIND YOUR HOTEL BOOKING THROUGH THE SOUTHWEST APP
- Open up your world to more travel experiences with each hotel booking
- Check into your hotel via the Southwest app
- Manage your reservation and find hotel deals
- Earn Rapid Rewards points1 for each hotel booking

BOARDING PASS ON THE GO
- Mobile boarding passes for all Passengers on your trip 24 hours in advance
- Flight Number, Confirmation Number, Boarding Time, Tier Status, and TSA PreCheck® details found in one place
- Save your Mobile Boarding Passes to Google Wallet for convenience

NEW - GETAWAYS BY SOUTHWESTTM
-Book your entire vacation package—flight, hotel, rental car—all in one place. It’s our most flexible way to vacay
- It’s never been easier to get away. Cancel or make changes to your package up to 10 minutes prior to your first departure*
-Use the in-app booking widget to search vacation packages in 30+ popular destinations like Las Vegas, Orlando, Hawaii, Cancun, Punta Cana, and Montego Bay

*Cancel/change 10 min before sched. depart. or funds forfeited. Price diff. & penalties may apply w/in 72 hrs. Add’l terms may apply. Terms can be found at Southwest.com/vacations/terms-and-conditions/

MORE WAYS TO PAY FOR YOUR FLIGHT
- Choose from multiple payment methods, including PayPal®, Flex Pay, credit/debit cards, and Southwest LUV Vouchers®
- Easily apply unused flight credits and gift cards when booking or changing your flight. You can find available credits in ‘My Account’ under the ‘Travel Funds’ section.

ACCESS INFLIGHT INFORMATION
Use the app to take you to our Inflight Entertainment Portal2, where you can watch free live TV3, access free on-demand TV episodes, and view free movies.

2Available only on WiFi-enabled aircraft. Limited time offer. Where available.
3Due to licensing restrictions, on WiFi-enabled international flights and free live TV may not be available for the full duration of the flight.

LIVE CHAT SUPPORT
Contact our Customer Representatives over Live Chat through our Help Center found in the “More” tab


AIRPORT PICKUP AND DROP-OFF
Seamlessly find transportation from the airport to your hotel. Thanks to our partnership with Lyft®, you can now use the app to help you request a Lyft®! You’ll know key information like estimated time of arrival and estimated price before booking. More of a rental car person? You can do that in the app, too.


EARN RAPID REWARDS POINTS WHEN YOU TRAVEL
Sign up for Rapid Rewards and earn points on your flights. Did you forget to add your Rapid Rewards number during booking?–No worries, add it after booking your flight and earn points1.


Book a flight, schedule pickups and drop-offs, enjoy fast and easy hotel booking, and embrace last-minute flights for your next spontaneous vacation–all with Southwest.
summary: Flight booking, hotel booking & more - all in one place with the Southwest App!

scraped_reviews.content: terrible app. I am trying to just see my boarding pass when I am getting on a plane, should be simple right? Yet somehow this simple task is requiring me to recheck in each time, and just overall cumbersome to use. Then on top of that, I get pop up ads to buy more of your terrible flight service? I already paid you and you still gotta do that just to inconvenience people who already paid you? Never again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're truly sorry for the frustration. 💙 Viewing your boarding pass should be easy, and we appreciate you sharing this experience. If you're open to it, we'd love more details so we can better improve this — please email us at SWADigital@wnco.com. ✈️-Arlene SWADigital

scraped_reviews.content: I've never used an airline app that makes it so difficult to see boarding passes. That should be the most functional part of the app. There's no simple 1-click option to see a boarding pass. You have to go to check in, then check in (even if you already have), and then you can see boarding passes. And if your screen shuts off, the app makes you go through all that again. That's 2 steps more than should be necessary. Terrible functionality.

Glitches out and won't accept the name on a new credit card. You put in one character and the field disables itself. Backspace doesn't even work. PayPal didn't work either, which in fairness may be an issue with PayPal. But since I can't input a new credit card, I can't buy flights with the app! Edit - email sent. There were no special characters.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry for the trouble adding payment details. The name field doesn’t accept special characters, which may be causing the issue. If you’re still running into problems, please email us at SWADigital@wnco.com
with your device and Android version so we can help. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: I downloaded this for a trip. It is convenient to track gate changes, etc. Every couple days it sends an ad notification. I didn't know I was downloading adware. Its so hard to find trustworthy companies. You can turn off the notifications, but you shouldn't have to. I'm sure most people wouldn't choose to turn them on, and many don't know how to turn them off. Its just more greedy business practices. I'll uninstall after the trip.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your feedback. We’re sorry the notifications felt intrusive. 💙✈️ We’ll share your comments with our Leadership Team as we continue working to make the app experience more helpful and less disruptive.

scraped_reviews.content: This is the worst app ever! So confusing! ended up having to use Southwest on my return flight, don't even know if I have a checked bag or not and it looks like if I want to add one it's going to cost me $155, are you freaking kidding me! I really need to just try and stay with Frontier airlines, very easy, not confusing and inexpensive! Southwest used to be my go-to but haven't used them for years, I hate that I have to use them now! next time, I'll wait the extra day to stay on frontier.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry for the confusion! For last-minute baggage questions, please give us a call so our Team can help right away. You can also find details on bag policies here: support.southwest.com/.../baggage
. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: Only used it for one flight, but the app is extremely annoying to use if you choose not to sign in. Retrieving a booking is case-sensitive, so if you capitalize your first or last name it gives an error. Moreover, it doesn't save a booking once retrieved, so every time I close the app my boarding pass disappears and I have to search for the booking again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the thoughtful feedback. We’ll share your notes with our Team as we continue improving the app. In the meantime, signing in with your Rapid Rewards account helps keep trips and boarding passes saved without re-entering info. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: Probably the second worst airline app out there. Half the time the app gives me a "something went wrong" with an arbitrary error code that doesn't make sense to support when you contact them. You can tell technology is Southwest's achilles here. App is slow to load, PayPal never works when checking out, and hasn't for 2 years now. Flex Pay works half the time. They normally charge my card or PayPal too many times, so I have to dispute it. Just an overall bad experience and a huge headache.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
✈️💙 We’re sorry for the frustration with errors and payments. That’s not the experience we want for our Customers. Please email SWADigital@wnco.com
with your device, OS, and error details so our Team can help. We appreciate your feedback as we work to improve!

scraped_reviews.content: I can't find what I need on the app. I booked the first leg of my travdl fairly easily, but I couldn't book my return flight at all. The app was locked, so today after trying a couple more times, I gave up and talked to a customer service person. She booked my return flight easily, but I'm taking my dog and she couldn't answer my questions, but while. Your App changes SUCK! I've been flying Southwest for at least 35 years, but I can't dven finish your questionaire here!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
We’re sorry for the trouble booking your return flight and for the frustration with recent changes. 💙 We’d love to learn more so our team can investigate, and we’d also love your feedback for improvements—please email SWADigital@wnco.com
with your Rapid Rewards number and details. Thanks for sharing! ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: They used to be great but no more! They changed their bag policy which used to be the sole reason I flew with them and now it's made flight after flight delayed so they can check bags after the flight has started to board. Then they want to pick out any little thing as you are boarding. I happened to say out loud how I felt it was stupid and the girl at the gate wanted to try to correct me on how it isn't and last time I checked I'm still allowed to have my opinion. Time to book other airline
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We know change can be tough, and we’re sorry to hear about your experience. We appreciate you sharing your perspective, and we’ll be sure to pass your feedback along to our Team. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: Booking process missing essential details (flight, departure, landing, layover times). When looking at booked flights, only shows the departing flight, have to hit the edit pencil icon to see return flight info... not intuitive. Applying flight credits requires you to look up the credit by original flight confirmation #, even though it should be associated with account. Seems like some product manager went on a quest to simplify the interface, but ended up making a hard to use one.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Marcus, Thanks for taking the time to share such detailed feedback 💙. We never want the booking or trip review process to feel confusing. If you'd like to share more specifics, please feel free to email the SWADigital@wnco.com email and reference this post. I'll turn this feedback in with this week's report. Thanks again! ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: I agree there should be one touch to get boarding pass. You should incorporate the function auto-insurance apps use when you just need to show cards. Imagine if they didn't have that, no one would cruise the entire app to see cards. Put a boarding pass widget, GET BOARDING PASS HERE, NOW ONE TOUCH BOARDING, on the face screen. I always take a screen shot of it so I don't need to redo everything to see my pass. Screen shot and leave pic on screen. Shouldn't need to put best option for me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your ideas—we know quick access to the boarding pass is important! Check-in is available on the home screen within 24 hrs when signed in, and your boarding pass can also be stored in your Wallet. We’ll share your feedback with our Teams. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: I have more than one reservation, but the app only shows one, and I have to search for the other reservations every time I want to pull up the boarding pass, even on the day of the flight at the airport. My TSA precheck KTN is saved in my profile, but I still have to add it manually to every flight. There are some things that an airline app should be doing automatically and this one fails to do so. If I were not a tech-savvy individual I would be lost using this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for sharing this detailed feedback. 💙 If you’re signed in during the booking process, your KTN should automatically appear. Please update the app and let us know at SWADigital@wnco.com
if this doesn’t work so I can share with our Teams. ✈️ -Arlene M, SWA Digital

scraped_reviews.content: DO NOT UPGRADE IN APP! I attempted to upgrade a return trip of a round trip flight. I applied my credits and made the changes with no issues, at no point did it say it wouldn't work or that you couldnt do only 1 part of the flight. My return flight was then "unticketed" according to the customer service agent I called and I was returned funds and my credits were returned. No email was sent, no call, nothing, why have the option to upgrade 1 portion of a trip if it causes you to not be ticketd
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so sorry for the trouble with your upgrade and the confusion it caused. If you're open to it, please email us at SWADigital@wnco.com with your device info and any booking details you can share—we’d really like to look into this further. 💙✈️

scraped_reviews.content: Perfectly fine airline app—I can check my flight details or use a digital boarding pass, and, even better, I can use that digital boarding pass from Google Wallet which is faster and more convenient to use. Four stars because I receive VASTLY too many marketing push notifications (3 or 4 or week.) Sure, I can (and have) revoked notification permissions, but needing to do this is already a step too far.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the thoughtful review! 💙 We’re glad you find the app and Google Wallet boarding pass convenient. We hear you on the push notifications and appreciate you sharing that feedback—it helps our Teams as we work to improve the experience. ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: I read a review from 2 weeks ago that mentions the issue where passport scanning never loads even if you manually give the app camera permissions. Well, now I'm in Mexico with a flight tomorrow and that exact same issue. This will cause me to have to make several calls to adjust my transportation sooner so I have time to go to the check in counter for an incredibly basic feature. Also, they clearly use AI to respond. As someone in tech, this is pathetic.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, My name is Arlene in SWADigital - and often I am writing these responses individually. I'd love some more details such as your Rapid Rewards number and Reservation number at SWADigital@wnco.com. I get a few emails, so please mention this post. The passport scanning is fairly new and we'd love to help.

scraped_reviews.content: no problems with the app usage or the airlines themselves, but I've noticed that every time I have notifications from other airline apps, southwest "randomly" drops a promotional notification. it's not a hack, it's allowed in the agreement you allow, albeit the app requires it. It still feels like an invasion of privacy. I don't recommend having the app on your phone unless you have a flight, then deinstall right after.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback. 💙 I’ll be sure to pass it along to our leaders. We appreciate you letting us know your perspective, and we’ll keep your experience in mind as we continue to improve. ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: I can lookup reservations (although confirmation codes are case sensitive which is incredibly dumb) but there's no way to add them to My Trips, so I have to look them up again each time I want to see them -- what is the point then in having the app on my phone? The reservations should be added automatically to My Trips when I look them up, or at the very least have a button to add them myself.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing this feedback 💙. After retrieving a flight, you can edit the Customer information to include your Rapid Rewards number—then the trip will appear in your upcoming trips when you’re signed into the app. We hope this helps make things easier for you! ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: Difficult. It's hard to locate the flight ticket. While standing in line the Southwest app froze so I went to the online site and we had the hardest time locating our boarding pass. We had to go back downstairs to an agent to get our boarding pass. on the way down I uninstalled the app then was able to pull up the boarding pass. of course by that time we had the hard copy in hand. We've decided not to use the Eticket
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
We’re sorry for the trouble you had accessing your boarding pass—that’s not the experience we want. 💙 If you’re willing, please email SWADigital@wnco.com
with your Rapid Rewards number, confirmation (PNR), and reference this review so our team can look into it further. Thanks for sharing your experience. ✈️

scraped_reviews.content: This has to be one of the worst apps in existence. you can't import a flight into your trips if it was booked externally. Every other airline does it. So now customers have to memorize confirmation numbers and punch them in any time they want to check and have to keep entering codes in since it gives an error and boots you out any time you look at different details about your upcoming flight. 0/10 would rather fly Malaysian Airlines than SW.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Manage reservation>edit Customer details, has a field to add a Rapid Rewards number. When you are signed into the same account, the reservation should show in upcoming trips. Thanks so much for reaching out and being a Customer! 💙

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of the worst apps I've ever used. I logged in with my rapid rewards number, created an account and password. It knows my login info, but makes me log in, alternating rapid rewards number and user name and password, which I've changed five times. It was literally easier to print out a piece of paper. The Walmart of airlines. I don't shop at Walmart. BTW, I logged into my Delta app with the touch of a button, and it's encrypted. Not flying with them again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for the frustration with login and password resets. 💙✈️ For help with your username or password, please call our Team at 1-800-435-9792. We’ll share your feedback with Leadership, and we hope to have the chance to serve you again in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: I am so glad we can finally track bags in the app! SW has been years behind other airlines on something so simple! Thank you for finally getting it together! But I'mma need y'all to figure it out on the app not refreshing/taking you back to the home screen if you click out the app for a quick second/by mistake. It should "save where you left off" for at least 2 minutes so that we don't have to start over, like booking a flight, reviewing account info, etc.

App is glitchy and poorly designed. When checking in or looking up a flight status, you have to manually enter the flight details each time, which is ridiculous. Worse than that, the only way to bring up a boarding pass is to check in to a flight (again entering all the details and confirmation code) - even if you're already checked in! This is by far one of the worse designed apps I've ever used. It's worst than pointless, it makes simple and necessary things much more complex and difficult.

There are good and bad features about this app. One of the cons is that it never remembers my login information. Another is that every time the system updates, all my points get wiped out. So much for "no blackout dates." Other than that, the airline itself is reliable, friendly, and accommodating within reason. I like that they let families with children under 6 board before general since their seating is always open and not assigned.

Putting 3 stars because, most of the time, the app works ok. I use it a few times a year. But the check-in notifications and check-in buttons are slow to appear. I have to refresh the app or close it and reopen it for the button to show up. And the last time I tried to use the app in flight, I could not connect online to do anything. That process is also not very user friendly. The airline itself is much better than its app.

Works well for me, and it's usually user-friendly. It's easy to make changes or cancel. I do wish they listed your available travel funds when you clicked that option, especially if you have them available. I don't like that I have to go find my confirmation # and then search for them. Otherwise, besides the occasional glitches, I'm satisfied.

The app is handy for early check ins and for quick access to boarding passes. The alerts are helpful as well for reminding you to get to the gate for boarding, especially if you are like me and like to explore the airports! The app is also helpful for checking up on options for flight changes and getting alerts for delays and gate changes. It takes a bit of navigation practice to be able to understand changing flights, etc., but other than that it is fairly easy.

It is a hassel to deal with. Every time I need to go back to my boarding pass, it makes me click "check in" again. Other apps have allowed me to just pull up the app and straight to my boarding pass no need to check in over and over. When I swich apps and come back to it, the same thing happens and I am back to square one. Not a big fan. The app is confusing and when I try to type my confirmation number to look up my flight, it doesn't have the option to type in letters.Not user friendly.

It's ease of use is great if you know specific dates and if there are flights available, but it's very frustrating that you can't use the low fare finder in the app. I'm often looking to fly back home into Des Moines which doesn't offer flights every day, so when I complete a search on a day without a flight it just fails. Then I type in a new date, and it fails...new date, fails. Then finally I give up and pull the full website up on my phone and search the low fare calendar. Way easier.

So buggy when it comes to buying an upgraded position, though it might be because the backend technology. I had issues last October (2022) buying a position upgrade after checking in, and now for my next flight (July 2023), it's still giving me similar issues! It's like they don't have a competent technology stack... Oh wait, they don't. And their app suffers because of it.

The app might be good, but I had an agonizing time trying to set up a password. It may be that I tried to use two different ID names after I got confused by the requirements. But there was no way to check with ID was being used. And in any event, when I tried to reset my password, I quickly timed out with. "Too many tries) error messages. I probably spent 45 minutes trying to sign in I generally think of myself as very computer. Illiterate, having used personal computers for 50 years.

Great app, we only fly Southwest. Can't beat 2 free checked bags...Period!! Booking flights is easy to do and finding deals is also easy. I wish I could get the companion pass again!! Quick edit, please put on the app under the points everyone has how much money credits they have available. I just booked 2 flights and didn't know I had like $300 available to use because you can only see it if you use the website on a computer, laptop, tablet or web browser on your phone. Thanks

Why don't you allow for credit card information to autofill? Also can't paste a gift card number. You make it difficult to pay for your service. Also, I loathe apps (ESPECIALLY travel apps) that restart every time you close it even though you go right back in 2 seconds later. No one has time to constantly reenter their information. I don't think holding the previous session in place for one minute is going to hurt. Other than that I ❤️SW

I love how you don't get charged all of these extra ridiculous fees when you fly with Southwest!!! ❤️ However, this app is very glitchy, and I sometimes have to sign in on my laptop just to buy the same ticket. The app pops up with error codes, like, "This action cannot be completed at this time. Try again later." 😓 The airline itself is fantastic, though! SOUTHWEST IS THE BEST!!! 😎

Very frustrating when there's a sale! There is no option to view only flights that are reduced price. You have to go through the whole process of finding a flight and then see if it's on sale. Please please please give people the option to view only flights that are impacted by a sale. For example right now there's a "wow50" sale, if I enter my departure City there should be a button that only shows destinations impacted by the sale. Otherwise this app is a waste of time and completely useless.

The app is somewhat useful, but it has its frustrations. It's frustrating that you can't select a flight you need to check in for and go directly to check in, instead you have to pull up check in and then enter your information. It seems like those should be linked within the app. Also, it would be nice to be able to store multiple accounts so I can access my toddler's information as well. I would also like to see a fare calendar like you can when you search for flights on the website.

It's nice to keep track of trips, but I have yet to successfully book a trip with it. It errors out before the purchase goes through and I end up booking online. Yesterday, it errored out at the payment because the airfare rate changed WHILE I was booking and they wanted to charge me $5 more per flight. VERY frustrating.

I love how easy it is to use. I don't fly much but every time I do I fly with southwest because they have great deals. In addition, the app makes it so much easier+stress free to fly. Your able to book a flight, check on your flight to see any changes, check in, book a car where ever your going to be staying if needed, and even book your hotel on here too. It has everything you need in one app. I also like how when you get the app you can sign up as a guest or a member.

it is very confusing. For instance, I just booked a flight, and there was an option for early bird booking. I would have bought that, but it did not highlight, so I could not add this. Does that mean it was included already? Or do I need to call to get it added? Another thing, your web site does not accept my TSA precheck number. Other airlines do, but with you I have to waste time in the general boarding lane.

Doesn't seem to do anything at the moment. I can type in my confirmation 
number and it let's me check in, however many times I want. Doesn't appear 
to link my account when I signed up online and the mobile version. The app 
says I have no up coming flights or any info actually. It has my correct 
rewards number, name, and contact info. Sign in on the website on PC and 
it's all there.

This app has not been working AT ALL lately. I can't even login without an app error, let alone edit details, check into flight, ensure my earlybird status. At least I can use the confirmation number to see my flight. And there is no one at southwest to help. I get that times are hard these days...but for people who have purchased tickets well in advance should at least have a functioning mobile app if the 800 number is out of service.

The app is not easy for seniors to use! You can't enlarge any of the microscopic print. There is no one to talk to when you are having trouble with the app and I don't like the fact that the sale was only available through the app!!! I never do financial transactions through my phone and am not happy I was forced to. Also there is no low fare calendar for checking prices for different days. I literally had to punch in every day between Aug and Dec to find the cheapest flight. Grrrr!

Volatile pricing, sometimes from hour to hour. I had to hold off on buying my ticket just for an hour or 2 while I awaited some information from my sister, who I was traveling with. When I went to book the flight a little later that SAME day, the price had increased significantly. I feel like SWA does that intentionally. You are not the airline I once loved. There are several things I could list here, but I don't have the time.

Does everything an airline app should. This month, I've been able to book flights, get my boarding passes (and save them in case airport wifi fails me), check flight status, and stream in-flight movies better than the Airtime player ever did. This app works. On top of that, it gives push notifications when boarding starts, and also gave me a push notification to alert me of an opportunity for a free rebooking to avoid weather delays/potential cancellation for a flight the following day.

I dislike I cannot see my upcoming flight for easy boarding pass retreaval. After checking in for my upcoming flight, I would have assumed I would be able to see my flight information without having to put in the confirmation # over and over. I typically fly Delta and maybe I'm spoiled by them but they have a very easy to use and friendly app. This app, for me, is very difficult to find anything.

The primary purpose of this app is to sell you something, promotions, upgrades, etc. I understand this being an important part of the app but it goes way too far! Where is my booked flight? Why can't it remember my confirmation number? When I find my flight, why can't I save it (I see a link for "saved flights" but no obvious way to save them). I get the feeling that the end user's needs were not even considered.

Have been using this app for some time. Now with updates, I have to login each time I use, opens slow. No fun when trying to get boarding pass.I thought updates are supposed to make things better, or is it just me? And why do I have to enter funds info in to find how much I have left? If I'm logging into my account, why isn't that info just in there?

You have to watch your prices. There is a policy at Southwest that says no change fee, but if you change your itinerary and do not check they may just slide your ticket over at the former higher price. Most generally if the price were higher you would pay the difference so if the price is lower you should get a refund. This is alot faster than dealing with an agent. It's not necessarily better. A question you want answered may take days if you submit it online.

Do not like changes to the app that did not retain previous payment information, passenger information, and doesn't populate my Rapid Rewards number. It requires you to go look up your RR number in the middle of booking a flight. Oh, and not liking the much higher fares. I'm now looking at other airlines instead of just defaulting to Southwest.

I love the convenience the app gives me for checking in and generating an electronic boarding pass. I wish there was a tab marked "My Flights" that allowed me to see upcoming and past fights. The information should include booking numbers that allow me to click on them to check in instead of going to emails to retrieve booking numbers. Just a thought.

The app meets most needs for my flights as I am flying at least once a week for business. The biggest problem that I have with the app is that it does require separate check-in for any companion flights. This means I can travel and check-in all my passangers on my ticket, but if I have some traveling with me on a companion pass, then I have to check them in separate at the desk, kiosk or web. Would be much easier if we could just check them in through the app or included with my check-in.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi There!  Wanted to share an update with you.  On Feb 6, 2020 we improved the app to support multi-passenger mobile boarding passes without logging in.  Learn more here: https://swa.is/2Savw0K  So sorry for the inconvenience but thanks for your feedback and thank you so much for flying with us.  -Mark

title: Squishmallows Match
description:
Dive into the world of Original Squishmallows™ with this relaxing, match-3 puzzle game! Unlock and collect rare Squishmallows as you solve fun puzzles and complete exciting challenges. Customize your player feed to showcase your growing Squad and share your achievements with friends!

Enjoy exclusive seasonal content with season passes, discover limited-time drops tied to real-world events, and test your luck with the claw machines to win even more adorable Squishmallows. With no timer to rush you, you can take your time, solving puzzles, unlocking new Squishmallows, and enjoying endless fun at your own pace.

Collect Squishmallows Your Way! 

- Collectible Squishmallows: Unlock and collect rare, limited-edition Squishmallows styles as you progress through the game. Your Squad grows as you solve puzzles and complete special challenges.

- Personalized Player Feed: Customize your player feed to show off your -Squishmallows Squad and creative designs. Share your progress and achievements with friends! Collect Backgrounds and Stickers to show off your collection with your own unique style.

- Season Passes & Exclusive Drops: Enjoy exclusive seasonal content and rewards with season passes. Look out for limited-time drops that are tied to real-world Squishmallows events and promotions!

- Claw Machines: Try your luck with the claw machines to win new, rare and even exclusive Squishmallows. The excitement never ends!

- Squishmallows Rewards: Earn Squishmallows points the more you collect, and make progress on the Squishmallows Reward Road! The higher your Squishmallows score the more rewards you receive, including Keys to unlock your favorite Squishmallows.

- Squishmallows Hunt: Want to find that special Squishmallows? Use Magnets for a better chance to get the one you want, and add your favorites to your Wishlist and unlock with Keys.

- Relaxing Gameplay with No Timer: Play at your own pace, there’s no timer, so you can relax, unwind, and enjoy solving puzzles without the pressure to rush.

- Match-3 Puzzle Gameplay: Solve thousands of fun puzzle levels by matching colorful Squishmallows, with each level offering new challenges and surprises.

Contact us for support at: support@squishmallowsmatch.zendesk.com 

By downloading this app, you agree to our privacy policy and terms of use, available at:
Terms of Service - http://www.eastsidegames.com/terms
Privacy Policy - http://www.eastsidegames.com/privacy

Please note that this game is free to download and play, but some game items are available for purchase using real money.
