Terms of Service: https://quizlet.com/tos
Privacy Policy: https://quizlet.com/privacy
summary: Smart tools that teach you: flashcards, interactive practice tests and AI tools

scraped_reviews.content: works great. Just wish it had a bit more. Like I wish I could add images/diagrams to both the sides of the flash card. right now you can only add an image to once side. They do have a work around but then you only have that one slide/image. I don't like this because then I will have 20 separate slide sets rather than having them combined in one set. if you use the AI upload, it isn't perfect. I tried uploading sheets with terms and their definitions. I think it was like 90% correct.

I wish the best feature weren't behind a paywall, but being used as a simple flashcard app, it's pretty good. I like that you can have folders and even class sections for flashcard sets. I did cave and get the premium version because the practice exams are the best study tool for me. It can also turn your notes into flashcards which is a MASSIVE time saver when you study genetics like I do. Even without premium you can use it for alot of things. Overall I'. pretty happy with it.

love it but need's more options to organize when you are .not a student or teacher. I am using this to study for my job. it's a lot of information and no way to break. things down into sections. are limited to 5 documents or images per session. I would also like to see a mater test option that allows you to combine all information in one folder to do a practice exam of the total content. print option of study and quick guides would also be nice.

I'm using Quizlet to learn Farsi. I love the games it has to help you learn (automatically created from your flashcards), and you can create custom flashcards. The learning algorithm works pretty well, and the tests are great. You can choose between matching, true false, and written, and also if I want to answer in Farsi only, English only, or both. Finally I create sets of flashcards and put them into folders. You can test all within a folder, or individually. A great study tool.

Buggy app with very limited free features in addition to adverts. Based on what I saw, I'm definitely not interested in the paid version. I was able to log in twice with the same credentials I use on the laptop, then suddenly the app says my username or password is wrong. Support just tells me to try using correct credentials. What a genius idea! I should have thought of it!

This app is great for learning, it helped me memorize my history notes under like 2 hours. But, I thought the test option is free all the way, but then, when I NEED to use it one more time to see how much I remember, it needs subscription. Payment. In America, the payment might be a little cheap, but as a Filipino, it's very expensive. This pisses me, and not just me, but other broke students too. Why do We need to pay a dumb subscription, just to get good grades? It's handy, but NOT recommend.

such an AMAZING studying app. I never study! I had such a bad habit of procrastinating studying until the last minute or just not do it at all and feeling comfortable with mediocre marks. This app had me study for HOURS on end. I have finals coming up so studying is a big part of my life right now. I searched up my curriculum and found good flash cards. Ended up studying for 3 hours non-stop! I absolutely recommend this app! it's so good

Just an amazing app bringing old school flash cards to your phone or device. This gives me the option to study anywhere and everywhere without having to carry a brick of flashcards with me wherever I go. I'm in nursing school, so the course is fast and intense. I went to a wedding the day before and exam. Sure enough, every second of down time I was on Quizlet. Not only is the flashcard option amazing, so are the other options. The "learn" and "test" options are perfect. (No more characters left

I've only used Quizlet for flashcards, and it's been great so far. I add new cards to the pack on the web version then use the app to review the vocabulary. I do wish it had a better and easier interface for adding new cards; the web version is a little clunky for that. I love that the app has an option to hear the word, but I've noticed the stress is wrong in a few cases, so I just started including the stress when I create the cards.

Overall, Quizlet is an amazing free study tool. Although, I have problems with the app. The app is a downgrade from the website. I mainly have problems with the flashcards. I find it annoying how I have to swipe away cards when zoomed in. Especially when I have big sets containing around 150+ words. It's a huge time waster. Literally, just add a next button. What makes it even worse is I can't favorite/edit cards without zooming in on flashcards or going to the editor. Maybe add a search tool.

The study guide is very good and useful for my class work. I would give it 5 stars, but there were a few cons with the app (via the phone app). For starters, in the flash card creations, when inputing the term, it's takes a bit of a delay to tap the definition in. The second thing is the testing session, it only allows one test. Otherwise, you have to pay a monthly subscription. I used the app 7 years ago and there was no monthly subscription for practice test. please fix.

The free part is ok, but you can only test one time using it. I just don't want to pay for an app when I could write it out on paper for free. But it has some other free features that are nice. Oh...the ai is silly. I played it but it kept saying I did well when I didn't and did poorly when I was correct. It looks for key words that are too specific; 'saving' vs 'removing' from harms way or stuff like that.

It's a great way to make your own flash cards , study them, or discover other people's flash cards for exams or for self learning. I find it easier to create personalized flash cards on a pc , then study them on my phone, and have the portability to retrieve them from anywhere. The pro (paid) version is worth it and inexpensive. I hope they don't raise the price.

It's very useful, but I really, really wish you could check off words that you know and don't want to pop up anymore. You can favorite certain terms, but often that's a much more cumbersome way to go about things because you have to reassess them constantly, whereas if you could check off words as you're sure you've got them, it'd be infinitely more convenient.

You get absolutely bombarded by advertisements and alerts, and the interface for making flashcards is a little clunky once your list gets large (say, >100 items). Hard to delete items or check for duplicates. But, it's a free app, these things are somewhat expected. Update: I have now paid for the premium app and am still getting requests to rate this app, despite having already left a review. However, the desktop version solves some of the problems of the mobile app. So, still 3 stars.

I'm extremely disappointed to say that quizlet is not longer useful to me. For years I used quizlet to make studying easier and more effective, and it worked. This study tool was was a life saver. After a year break I opened up quizlet again to quickly find that it's nothing more than a greedy scam now. 1 free practice test and 5 free rounds to learn material. That's all you get from the most effective tools. I'd never recommend Quizlet to anyone.

Was the only app that helped me through high school and college, as a lower class student. I don't have the means to pay multiple subscriptions, along with my tuition. Quizlet was the only website that I felt really just wanted to help those in need. With the pay wall, I can't even use the app. Shame on you quizlet, MILLIONS of lower class students will no longer be able to use your platform, and struggle because of it.

it's really good for all types of classes! I personally use it for my AP classes and honestly I would not have passed without it. The app isn't necessary but it does make it convenient and easily accessible which always helped me when I didn't have motivation to actually sit down at my desk with my computer, and books, and notebooks, and all that stuff. Instead I could just lay in my bed and do flashcards, it rocks!!

I needed something to be able to practice for my CompTIA exam. Some of the terms I needed to remember were number based and I'm lousy with remembering numbers. I was able to setup a list with 20 protocols and their port numbers and the app just setup a randomized multiple choice test that I could do over and over again until I was answering every question correctly. I would have used this months ago if I knew about it. The best part is it has a website that you can log into, create lists from there instead of your cell phone, and it can be accessible from any portable device that has access to the app.

Wish this app had been around when I was in high school! Both myself and my 13 year old daughter use this app and the desktop site for studying. Invaluable, time-saving, and worth every penny. So easy to type in notes and get clear, easy-to-use flashcards and practice quizzes. Similar to change the order or phrasing; to fix a or rearrange information if I need to.

There are always 3 ads per page you're on, which is fine! What's not fine is only letting students use one practice test and then saying they need to pay! We're broke! $7.99 a month just isn't there for us. I thought this was a free tool but it's just a money gauger. Why have so many ads in app and still ask for payment? I wasted time making flashcards that I can't properly use now. This app sucks.

I made 17 study sets a few years back. I wanted to share them with a friend recently, as we have annual recurrent training for work. When he installed quizlet he could only see and study 6 of them when he pulled up my user name. Something has changed, because there wasn't a limit before. I as the creator can still see and study all 17. This used to be a good app for group study, but not so much now.

The "Learn" and "Practice Tests" are locked behind a paywall. Quizlet doesn't give the option for one free use a day. Once you hit the free limit (five rounds), you're forced to pay to use them again. There is no opportunity to watch an ad for access if they want to monetize the app. It doesn't make sense when half of their user base is most likely those without disposable income.

Great tool for studying any time you have a few minutes free. Downside: flash cards are limited. Quizlet will not allow you to put a picture in the term section and only one picture in the definition section. Hate that. I want to be able to fully customize my flash cards, but you can't with Quizlet. And editing your flash cards from a mobile device or tablet is extremely frustrating. If you have may lines of text on a card, it won't all be visible in edit mode and trying to scroll is a pain.

It is an ok app. Not as good as Anki for studying. Edit: after using for a long time: I took a star away because in Quizlet it is too hard to organize your cards once you have a lot of them. If you plan on adding a lot of study material I suggest searching for another app. The search in the app is bad. I just searched for cards in one of my classes and they don't show up. I can find them easily on the web with the same search terms. I have contacted customer support about all these issues and the response is that they don't plan on making any changes.

Super Helpful. I've been using this app for 4 years now and it makes studying so much easier. I can access and edit my flash cards from any device. My friends can access them too and use them just the same. You can put passwords on your sets so only certain people can edit or even see them. The free version has worked just fine for me so far but if you want to do voice recordings and use your own pictures, then you would have to pay.

Like the online client the app works well. There isn't much to say about the functionality. The problem I have is with the stupid subscription pricing. The small added benefits do not nessesitate a subscription model no matter how small. It's just a cash grab. It should be a one time fee of 5 bucks or less. Give me a break, 2 bucks a month for night mode and offline use.

Great but I have some suggestions. On mobile, the images on flashcards are large and sometimes make the text too small to read comfortably, it would be nice to have the option to toggle images on mobile. Also, the option to hide flashcards in sets (without deleting them) would also be a nice feature. Lastly, Please let us sort folders by alphabetical order I'm the app. Thanks for providing a convenient study service!

Other than the reading out loud feature (which I hate on both the web app and less-so the phone app) I really like it. Especially the matching feature which is not only great when you need something other than wrote memorization, but also because you can challenge your friends to see who can match faster! This was also surprisingly helpful to studying. Spring for the ability to add pics if you're a med student like me. Also the autofinish feature is cool

5 stars because its the best and cheapest one I've used so far. 1. There is a free option: Use it online and access it on your computer or on your phone. Allows you to use basic flashcards (typing on both sides) and you can access other peoples sets. Thats all I really needed it for but I went ahead and bought the $20 a year thing. Can make your own flash cards with photos which I need to expand and improve my learning. Im studying anatomy and shadowing 2 PT, NDs so it really helps.

I love Quizlet, so the app makes me happy. It would be nice to be able to add cards directly at whatever point in the card sequence I choose vs. scrolling to the bottom. It would make it more convenient for keeping groups organized together within a large stack of cards. For example, being able to have one lesson of cards successfully grouped together within an entire unit of cards vs. new additions needing to be dragged all the way from the bottom of a large stack.

I use quizlet for EVERY test. You can study anywhere, anytime (even when driving to school 😊). Plus, you don't have to constantly carry a big stack of flashcards around and freak out when you think you've lost one. The best part is that you can add pictures to the cards, which is incredibly helpful for classes where you need to ID certain things (i.e., igneous vs. metamorphic vs. sedimentary rock, or plant ID). I don't usually make them on my phone though, since typing is easier on a computer.

LOVE THIS RESOURCE! Only one suggestion, when entering the data in a study set on the desktop, the intuitive suggestion (AWESOME btw), does not make the suggestion selectable WITHOUT mouse. Anyone familiar with other software's use tab, arrow, enter from the keyboard, but in Quizlet you have to leave the keyboard to select with mouse!?! At that point it's just as fast to type it myself! Just saying!

I miss the old Quizlet. I don't mind the ads but the fact that to use it to study was free, but now it feels like a micro transaction subscription to even do the basic stuff. Not only that, the quality of the app itself has gone down. It is hard to use and you have to step around the bugs to do anything in a sort of smooth manner. I might just use a different app all together if I can't get a better study from it. I don't believe it is worth buying the subscription at all.

Easy to use. I like the different learning formats - flash cards, matching, practice tests. My main criticism is the terms look to be written by laypeople, maybe even non-English speakers. The definitions are simplistic and somewhat nonstandard. Also, the system that checks the accuracy of your answer is annoying. You could answer correctly but fail to match the exact wording the app wants or even forget to add an S to pluralize a word, and it marks you wrong. Good study supplement only.

Support is incompetent and developers are blasé about many issues still present in the app after years. Flipping cards in learn mode still doesn't work properly if there is a picture on the card. The option to star the "still learning" cards is absent in the mobile app. It is impossible to zoom in to pictures on a card. Another example of their staggering intelligence is the app's "dark mode". Blue is the color most antithesis to being easy on the eyes, and it's the one they've chosen.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your response. We appreciate it. Can you tell us the device you are using at support@quizlet.com? We will try to evaluate the issue and get back to you.

scraped_reviews.content: Love this app. I could look up things i don't know, make my own study sets so I could take them wherever I go on my cell. Easy to use and you could customize your sets even print them out if needed. I could test myself to see if I know my material. The best app so far. Update: When I hit the learn mode an error always pops up. I deleted the app and downloaded it again but the error still pops up. I use the learning mode more then the other mode so could you fix the issue.

I wish that when i set several (many) flashcard sets for a certain "test date" using settings for the "learn" function, the app would be able to adapt my studies accordingly based on not only the last time i quizzed myself using "learn" but also how badly i need to study that set. As of now, say if I set 10 sets to be tested in 1 month, for the next month I'll get 10 reminders (1/set) every day to practice the sets whether i have mastered them or not, rather than spaced out according to need.

Whenever I go through the cards, it resets my progress and it drives me nuts. This might also be from some BS power saving mode option though. So also, and I'm not rating low because of this, and I know the solution is "pay for the service like you're supposed to" but when the ads are animated, it's really distracting. I kinda wish you could turn motion off on them because it always makes me lose my train of thought. I'm grateful for this app, y'all are doing a great job in general.

I was confused at first, I usually use quizlet online. I thought that you had to pay for learning mode. I was upset, I downloaded the app and you didn't need to pay for it, it's free. You can pay for it if you want your custom study path. Also upset that when doing the learning mode, I think there should be a FREE option to put images for terms as well, or it can get confusing. That's all! The learning mode is the part that gets me excited the most to study! Having quizlet for 2 years! :)

On a desktop, Quizlet added functionality to easily bold, italicize, and even highlight info on the flashcard which is great. However, when viewing cards on a mobile device that contain words that are both bold and non-bold, or words that are underlined and non-underlined on one slide, it doesn't display all of the words! They're simply just not there. I thought I forgot to add the info when I created the set on a computer, but they appear correctly on a desktop. Are you kidding me?!

Often frustrating. You can't add study sets to folders through the app. You have to do it through the computer. Once sets are added through your desktop browser, it's a good app. When you are studying a large study set, don't navigate away from it for ANY reason - even to answer the phone. You have to start over EVERY time. Really frustrating when you get through 80/90 questions and you have to start over.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry about this issue. Please contact us at support@quizlet.com and let us know the issue you encountered. We would be glad to help with this. Hope to hear from you soon.

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent app for paperless flashcards. Used it to study some stuff I needed to have memorized at work. Someone shared their flashcard sets with me and I was able to jump right in and start studying. Interface is easy to use and the features are helpful. The only thing I didn't like was, because I did not pay for a plan, it didn't let me download my flashcards which at times became inconvenient.

I really love the overall simplicity of the application. i just wish that the testing format would allow for a little more room for error. For example I would sometimes use plural wording in my notecards and that would cause me to get a question wrong. Even with this issue though the app allows for you to select when you got a question right despite minor spelling errors so it is a very minor issue.

I like quizlet. It is soooooooooooooooooooo easy to use! Pro's Very helpful if you haven't studied for a while, and your test is this week. Con's I dislike it when you search for something, and the first thing that pops up are your own study sets. Then you have to scroll down a while to find your searched set. Con's Some study sets are inaccurate! Pro's It is very easy to make your own accurate study sets. Con's I just wish the NIGHT THEME will be free one of these days. People need it!

I upgraded to the Plus because it said I could use pictures. I spent a couple hours making sets with a picture for the answer. I can see the front and back UNTIL I tap on flashcards, then NOTHING, just 3 dots where the picture should be. I thought maybe it took a few hours to upload, it's been 3 days. I've spent 3 days trying to look on line for help & under quizlet. I've emailed twice with no response. Has anyone else had this issue? If so, any advice would sure be appreciated! Thank you

Extremely customizable! It's nearly the perfect digitization of vocabulary studying. The only thing that could make quizlet better, in my opinion, is to expand the number of vocab words that appear in any one "matching" game. But that might be a matter of screen size. If you are learning a new language, need to master a restaurant menu, or taking vocab-heavy courses, I think you should buy the quizlet premium membership. It is totally worth unlimited vocab studying sessions!

Very useful and helps me pass tests. One of many various problems is that it detects words inputted that weren't plural/were plural as wrong. For example, the answer is samples, but you put sample, and recognizes it as wrong. Sometimessupposed to be specific, but COME ON! This is just infuriating, and makes me want to break my phone. Please fix this and I'll at least give you 4 stars. 😡

This was a longshot in trying to study some content for work. Within 15 minutes I realized it wasn't going to work for me. I was charged for a full month, even though it was on a 7 day trial period. Maybe just a glitch? But my bank shows a direct charge from Quizlet (not Google Play Store as described). Weird! I'm not worried about the fee as much as the predatory sales tactics (especially when it's supposed to be a service oriented product for education and schools).
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at support@quizlet.com. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: The quizlet app and website has been free for years but they recently changed to a paid model. You can get a few functions for free, but it's become largely useless without paying. It's fine to monetize it, but this is not the way to do it. The vast majority of quizlet users are students who can't pay and will leave. Not to mention it used to be a wildly used classroom resource but I doubt it will be anymore.

title: Google Lens
description: Google Lens lets you search what you see, get things done faster, and understand the world around you—using just your camera or a photo. SCAN & TRANSLATE TEXT Translate words you see, save a business card to your contacts, add events to your calendar from a poster, and copy and paste complicated codes or long paragraphs into your phone to save time. IDENTIFY PLANTS & ANIMALS Find out what that plant is in your friend's apartment, or what kind of dog you saw in the park. EXPLORE PLACES AROUND YOU Identify and learn about landmarks, restaurants, and storefronts. See ratings, hours of operation, historical facts, and more. FIND THE LOOK YOU LIKE See an outfit that catches your eye? Or a chair that's perfect for your living room? Find similar clothes, furniture, and home decor to the one you like. KNOW WHAT TO ORDER See popular dishes on a restaurant menu based on reviews from Google Maps. SCAN CODES Quickly scan QR codes and barcodes. *Limited availability and not available in all languages or regions. For further details go to g.co/help/lens. Some Lens features require an internet connection.
descriptionHTML:
Google Lens lets you search what you see, get things done faster, and understand the world around you—using just your camera or a photo.

SCAN & TRANSLATE TEXT
Translate words you see, save a business card to your contacts, add events to your calendar from a poster, and copy and paste complicated codes or long paragraphs into your phone to save time.

IDENTIFY PLANTS & ANIMALS
Find out what that plant is in your friend's apartment, or what kind of dog you saw in the park.

EXPLORE PLACES AROUND YOU
Identify and learn about landmarks, restaurants, and storefronts. See ratings, hours of operation, historical facts, and more.

FIND THE LOOK YOU LIKE
See an outfit that catches your eye? Or a chair that's perfect for your living room? Find similar clothes, furniture, and home decor to the one you like.

KNOW WHAT TO ORDER
See popular dishes on a restaurant menu based on reviews from Google Maps.

SCAN CODES
Quickly scan QR codes and barcodes.

*Limited availability and not available in all languages or regions. For further details go to g.co/help/lens. Some Lens features require an internet connection.
summary: Translate words, identify plants, find products, & more—using just your camera

scraped_reviews.content: Lens is a VERY useful app that I use nearly every day. I use it to capture text from images. Circle to search works for that as well, but is harder to use and also results in a string of words with no formatting. Lens preserves formatting. To grab a screen of text, press volume up and power at the same time. Then press the share icon and choose "Lens" - then simply highlight the text you want to capture. Besides the capture, a search of the text and results are presented. Great job Google!

This has helped me so many times trying to figure out what things were, but the real winner here is the translate option! I've never used it before until now! I recently bought something where the instructions were in another language. Pulled up Google Lens and was able to translate it. I actually started my screen recorder, and I clicked the "listen" open to have it read. Now when I go to put this together, I'll just play the screen recording and pause it whenever I need to!

Useful for lots of types of identifying items. I am pricing items for a moving sale This is even useful for identifying bugs like spiders or moths, all kinds of plants. It is not always accurate, but it gives you a lot of information. update: I'm going through the forest near me and identifying a lot of the plant life. it's amazing. it may not always be perfectly correct. but you have to check it yourself so you're always learning, and it doesn't cost anything!

I'm SO HECKIN' HAPPY to be able to see a neat plant in the woods... THAT I DON'T RECOGNIZE! (that doesn't happen very often) I can simply take a picture of it... then look it up when I get back in service! LIFE-CHANGING!! OCCASIONALLY it will think it's a different thing, but it almost always puts the correct option in the photos provided. VERY RARELY I'll only get the Genus suggested, and then have to peruse the whole Genus for a match, but that still cuts my research time down to <1/6 what it

This is a very nice way to search online for unusual items that you can't name, or forget what they're called. Just place the item by itself with a plain background and capture it with lens, just like you were taking a smartphone photo. Then wait a moment and let it search. I'm having FUN! It's very addictive and it's really helping me find similar items to whatever I point at, whether in a catalog or in person. Also superb for price comparison. But I need to find more Dollar stores around

A real time- saver! So far, Google Lens seems to bring up good visual matches for images. It helps if you have very clear, descriptive photos. Also, you need to carefully vet the results, as some of them aren't accurate... ALSO - the app is great for translating packaged product info printed in different languages!! LATER - this app works great traveling in Japan - you can read menus, instructions on various devices, etc. Very helpful!!!

I have used Lens so many times to identify everything from antique items, to plants, to foreign coins, and so much more. It's fast, accurate, and very easy to use. Just take a picture using the Lens app and it will find the item, and items that are similar and tell you what it is, how much it's worth and give you links to where else you can find it on the Internet. I recommend this app to everyone.

I've just started using this app, already knowing the names I was asking for as a test. So far, 100% accuracy. I hike alot, always out in the boondocks, and I get results instantly. I'm sold! UPDATE April 2025: I'm still loving it, no complaints at all. UPDATE Sept 2025: same as April but wanted to add a bit 😁. I've learned a lot about succulents, trees, and wildflowers by using this app. There's only been 1 instance of a misidentified plant, and I believe it was "operator error." 😅

this is a very useful app. I mostly use it to identify birds, plants, and insects. It's fast and usually accurate. but I'm disappointed that it is no longer directly available in Google Photos (still available, but I have to search for it in the "Share" menu). Also, it seems that lately the results are more commercial and less informational.

Genuinely one of the best apps ever made, imo, and an essential part of my day-to-day work. Is it right 100% of the time? No, but it's pretty close. And the information it is able to pull from all across the internet and then condense into concise, streamlined results is impressive. In my experience, it's definitely gotten more accurate since I first started using it and I imagine it'll continue to do so. Plus, it's fun to use to just learn about random stuff!

This is one of the most useful apps I've seen lately. A must if you want to identify something. It has identified almost everything I've tried to identify. It has even ID things a little out of focus. Objects it can't ID happens if there are several objects that are so similar that it's too hard to discern between them, or the object has not been entered into this database. But, that is getting more rare as more people update the database.

I've been using Google Lens since it was developed. It's come a long way since then. I use it several times a week for plant & bug identification and care instructions, and to look a specific item up that I see and am interested in purchasing. I would say it's about 98% accurate when trying to identify plants, bugs, etc. The only time is been 'wrong' is when there are multiple species that look similar in my experience. I didn't realize everything else it does until I read these reviews!

I can't get enough! OMG, if this isn't the very best # 1 app of all time it's close. My dear friend turned me onto the app 6 months ago. The 1st day I used it over 100 times. I use it every day at least a dozen times. Its accuracy is 99.9985%.idk 100really. I've thrown some very rare and partial pics of items and sure enough, it not only sees all but can even pick out authentic and/or counterfeit (to an extent!?) AND, the Lens app offers additional/historical info about the specific item.

works how it's supposed to, and, of course, it keeps getting better and better. I read a lot and research or read about everything. certainly a handy tool. it brings you a smidgen closer to infinite knowledge.... if it doesn't work well on your device, chances are it's a problem with your device. slow processing power or whatever.

Such a great app and tool. You can take pictures of things with foreign languages and then translate them later. Super helpful and useful when traveling. I use it all the time traveling. The only change I would suggest would be to be able to clear the screen of all the tools so you can have an uncluttered translated picture to take a screenshot or share the translated picture with other people or yourself.

This app has been on my smartphones for probably more than 10 years. I used it a few times for document capture or modification. I just used it to ID some flowers and it totally blew me away with the guidance and info it provided. I almost paid $40 for a plant ID subscription earlier today! Taught me a lesson: free doesn't always mean not useful or valuable.

Frankly, it's among the most proficient apps available today for image search, converting images to text and translating, or finding shopping results from images. The only instances where it tends to falter involve using highly fragmented or out-of-focus images, or when dealing with extremely rare items, such as a painting with an unrecognized signature. Aside from these scenarios, its performance is remarkably accurate. To be honest, it's genuinely impressive.

Best app ever. I use it to search anything. To identify almost anything. Coins, flowers, rocks, cars, buildings, products in store or online. Even the prices of items plus where to find them and it gives info on things you lens. You can translate languages or have it read aloud the text on screen. It will do your homework. I even us it to bust scammers on FB. It's not as easy to use with Reddit as you have to download the pic. Just improve facial rec on normal people and it be near perfect.

I can find anything and everything on this app. Clothes, places, antiques, odd things, photos, fake profile pics on FB. Especially useful for searching item descriptions when I don't know what to call something for my online sales. I simply take a photo and search it with LENS. Works flawlessly. Some items I want to buy are so expensive but I search the photo and it shows me multiple identical or close to items for sale across the Internet for a tenth of the price most times. Love it!!

Great to have on hand for so many different things! I use it to identify old tools, parts/peices, hardware, and antiques quite often. Identifying species of plants and trees. I go to this app when I have a serious question about something more than anything else by far. Some things are tricky and take images from a few angles to really narrow down.

It's pretty neat but still isn't quite "there" yet. It still doesn't identify alot but gives some input at least (for example, if I was trying to identify a plant and if it cant it will say "It looks like ... A plant?" Ive tried a few times and it has only been absolutely correct once ). It is still fun to try out though and will be patiently awaiting updates! :)

Use this a lot. Great invention. It's complete w pricing and availability. It's also free n I'm satisfied w/o an upgrade. Not monetizing so not paying... Am impressed w how well it works. It's an online Webster's Dictionary+. Now inclusive of slang.. no longer considered slang. And again, it's Free. I'm really very happy w the basic. We've been able to identify what grows, where, when, how. I didn't give 5 since it means perfection to me. It's not perfect.. but it's great.

Love this app!!! You can either take a photo or import one. It then quickly identifies it name and even gives you links to sources to buy it. You can also use it to give you an idea of the value of something you may want to sell. I also use it to identify plants, and anything related. Can identify insects, birds etc. I really need to put this app on the homepage because the number of possibilities with its use seems almost endless. It also gets better with time.

I love this app. I've used it for years to identify insects or an image, look up a product etc. I love to use it to take pics of text & copy paste it to a doc vs writing it out. The homework option is great to learn with or for a refresher. It shows you step by step how to solve a problem & websites to help. For translation, it auto detects the language on screen & shows the English (or chosen language) over top. Such an invaluable app! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

The app is hit or miss. I took a broken part out of a lamp and scanned the bar code on it. I was initially amazed when the app correctly ID'd the part on the first scan. The app even listed some on-line retailers for the part. I wanted to see if I could get it from Amazon, so I switched to the Amazon app. When I tried going back to the Lens app, it didn't show up in the list of recent apps, so I had to reopen the Lens app and rescan the part. My first scan must have been very lucky because this second attempt took many scans to finally get back to my initial result. For some strange reason, Google Lens does not show up in the list of previous apps, which is a pain when you need to switch between Lens and another app. Also, scanning the same thing multiple times produced very inconsistent results from scan to scan.

It's a decent app. It has its trouble recognizing stuff half the time, giving only things with vague color schemes as results, but I'm going to chalk it up to the technology not being as advanced as it could be, maybe bc of the budget. You used to be able to select text quite easily but they have removed it unless it is translated or the text is recognized in the original language, which it has gotten worse at :/ It was really useful and kinda bummed to see it gone.

Best app ever. I use it to search anything. To identify almost anything products in store or online. Even the prices of items plus where to find them and it gives info on things you lens. You can translate languages or have it read aloud the text on screen. Just improve facial recognise on normal people and it be near perfect. but This has helped me so many times trying to figure out what things were, but the real winner here is the translate option! I've never used it before until now!

Use to love using this app to figure out what prices are being charged for comic books and collectibles before I listed my stuff. However this app has been "re-worked" or maybe I should say "de-worked" to be useless for me now. I dont care to see the photo size on everything that comes up, I use to be able to go to the shopping option for prices and comparison shopping but that is gone and now its a bunch of stuff I have to click on that leds me nowhere helpful. I hate this app now.

Although it doesn't always recognize what I'm searching for it still does a pretty spectacular job of doing a variety of things very well. The ONLY functionality that I still really, really, really, REALLY-REALLY miss in Google Images search from the days of yore (which could be assimilated into this current iteration) is the ability to define parameters to seek hi-res imagery as well as being able to filter images by category for example, displaying them according to their file size, etc.

Lens has successfully helped me identify dozens of buildings, towns, gardens all around Europe in photos I took over twenty years ago but have since lost my diary record. A very useful, time saving app. I also use it regularly to successfully translate less familiar languages (Japanese, Icelandic, etc) but strangely it gives varying translations according to how far the device is held from the text. Nevertheless it always provides useful insights.

Another great Google app. Google has really outdone itself with this app and many more such apps. I've never had a problem with any of them. This app is a must-have. The app offers identification scanner. It keeps your photos in a gallery. It will even search the internet for items similar to your photos and find either prices or similar images that maybe better. Very highly recommended.

App is useful over half of the time. I'm a collector/seller so it really helps me to know not only possible value, but actual names and brands sometimes when I didn't know it. But sometimes it is WAY off pulling up totally different things and it would be great if we could tell it that that's not what they are pulling up and to try different stuff.

I Iove this app! It's fun and super helpful! Most cars, plants, animals, album covers and the like it does a fantastic job. For more obscure things like small figurines and old China, It usually finds that if it's out there. If not I can add a word or phrase to help the search engine. When it can't find it, I know that it's something obscure or rare. Feedback is requested after every search which I think they can use to refine their search engine. I am a fan!

I love the app for the most part, but it has a HUGE, glaring problem. When I search an image, and then want to see more about a specific result, the links and buttons don't work. I click/tap once and wait, nothing happens; I click/tap again, and nothing happens. Nothing happens at all 90% of the time. Even when I select a result just to look at it and compare, and when I want to navigate to one of the website results I can't most of the time.

The app is brilliant as far as concept and, on occasion, execution goes. Maybe I am somewhat ignorant but when two or three dots appear and I am still waiting for a different item to be identified, if I tap the screen it seems to select a random, if not the most recent, dot. Next, the rest disappear or they remain and move around when I try to get a better view of a certain object, even whilst the other dots are in the frame and this causes them to become unrecognizable. Honestly, I just don't feel like I am in control most of the time. Really cool app when it does what I want but, otherwise, it does need serious UI improvements. I expect more from Google.

Sometimes Lens works perfectly, fetching the exact results. Sometimes, it's not even remotely close. Today, it gave great results, but it didn't allow me to make any selection. When I touched the best result, nothing happened. Usually, it advances to whichever website I touch. I tried to access a drop-down menu to select "Open in a new tab" by touching and holding the selection. But that didn't work either. So, I finally took a screenshot to remember the information until I could write it down.

I have found far more items than not using Google lens and it's been a really helpful tool. Unfortunately, when it looks for photos you often have to go a couple Pages deep to find the item that you actually took a picture of so there's some glitches in the identification part of the program. There aren't any good instructions for how to take a picture that might be easier for it to identify, but overall I'd say it's a much more useful tool than not

Most of the time, this app works just great. Every once in a while though, for some unknown reason, even when the image it's scanning for is crystal clear, it will come back with the result image not found, unknown image, or unknown search. This can be completely frustrating and totally maddening. There should be a way to improve search results for this app just like there is in Google Maps and Google Photos.

There are soooo many Google apps that I use regularly. SOOO many... And this Google Lens app is one that truly astounds me. It is so beyond helpful in identifying everything from places, species of birds, insects, flowers, etc. that I photograph. It also is great in helping to identify items I own and need to repair, replace, list for sale, etc. but don't know or have forgotten their names (and sometimes even what they are). Kudos Google!

This app is really helpful in multiple ways... I've used it for more than just identifying what something is, finding out when it was created, the importance it has or may have had, an why it was made from the get go... Also it's very useful at times when wanting to sell something, and trying to figure out a value, or what it may be worth, as well as what it actually sold for...

I use this every once in a while, but ever since it stopped letting you easily search for "similar" photo, I find it less and less useful. Maybe someone got offended by copyright data or something. I dunno. Google keeps getting less and less useful and more and more corporate. I'm ready for someone / something new to come onto the scene and really shake things up. We're a out due for that right? I mean Google has reined supreme since inception, give some new blood a try eh?

I use this app to identify photos, not so much things in the field. I take lots of photos and foreign gardens, and many of the flowers are unfamiliar to me. This is allowed me to identify most of them. I've also found it useful for identifying specific buildings and different locations. Since the image doesn't change in a photo, I don't have problems as it changing the focus. I highly recommend this app!

Hasn't been very good at steadying the phototaking, unless flash is on, but that uuuuusually "flash-floods" the photo.. meaning it ends up being too bright to accurately see, in detail, what it is that you're trying to take a picture of. And in my opinion, the app works best when it can see your picture in better detail, so as to further define what it's supposed to be helping you search. And neither trade-off does the trick very well, atm. But! New update for the first issue, so we'll see! 🤞🏻

There are several apps identifying plants on Play Store. They all charge a fee, have short trial periods, or overwhelm with ads. After trying several to ID a single plant on my property I decided to give Google Lens a test. Faster, accurate results. no ads or fees. It was the only app that provided the common name and not just its Latin name. We found a chrome rack when packing for a move. We did not know what it went to. Lens identified it: whirlpool MW rack.

Translated Chinese to English (I believe) perfectly), even though the image was more than just a bit blurry. I didn't think it was going to work with the image I used, but I tried anyway figuring that I was going to have to retake the picture, but surprisingly it translated on the first try with a poor image. Way to go! I'm sort of shocked but very pleased with how well this app works! Thank you.

I give this a 5-star rating for when it does what I need it to. I know that makes it sound like it is unreliable, but it works pretty well. on the occasions it doesn't work, you just go back to Classic searching like you would have done anyway. Sometimes you just find a product with a part number or something and it will pull it up way quicker than you searching for it any other way. Another friend of mine also uses this to identify antique products that he doesn't really know what they are. A+ Google!

This app, though it can sometimes miss the mark, is incredibly useful... one of the greatest uses of AI devised thus far. I love this app and it is incredible for world travel as it can translate an entire menu or any signage in a matter of seconds. They were truly accurate when they said, "The future language of humanity will be AI." But not just translations, see a fruit or produce item you've never seen before, or a tree you want to identify? Take a quick photo and in a flash you'll know!

While staying at a hotel, I saw these lamps they had outside that would be great for my deck, I used Google lens to see if they were available online for purchase, and sure enough I was given over a hundred links for the same exact lamps for sale! Some at ridiculously expensive prices, and many others at incredibly low prices! (comparitively). 👍🏼 Awesome!

vLove it! When I first tried this a couple years ago, it definitely needed some work. Most of the things I tried searching for just were not in the database. Fast forward two years and what a difference! Most everything I look for (vintage estate items to value and price) have several results. Very rarely now, ( less than 5 % of the time) does it come up empty. The only issue I've had is more of a bug in the app issue where it will search for part of the picture which ends up way off base.

It works great for informational purposes initially. It would get 5 stars if not for the fact that it stopped working halfway through exploring the topic in question and failed to load the other tabs for other facets of information, then got stuck and wouldn't let me go back to the previous tabs, or close the search results menu to return to lens. It then proceeded to have a seizure and freaked out when I tried to close it. 😅 So yeah it's a great app, works 95% of the time, but then doesn't.

title: Facebook
description:
Where real people propel your curiosity. Whether you’re thrifting gear, showing reels to that group who gets it, or sharing laughs over fun images reimagined by AI, Facebook helps you make things happen like no other social network.

Explore and expand your interests: 
* Shop Marketplace for hidden gems and take your hobbies to the next level
* Personalize your Feed to see more of what you like, less of what you don’t
* Ask Meta AI for information and get answers instantly
* Drive into reels that reflect the things you're interested in
* Search Facebook on any topic and get more interactive results

Connect with people and communities:
* Join groups to learn tips from real people who’ve been there, done that
* Get inspired by creators, or catch up with Friends
* Add new Friends to your world, but also decide how closely to keep up with them
* Privately message relatable posts that only your BFF will get or that reels trend everyone’s talking about
* Catch up with your friends through video and voice calls

Share your world:
* Use generative AI to create custom stickers and images to delight friends
* Customize your profile to choose how you show up and who sees your posts
* Effortlessly create reels from trending templates, or showcase your creativity with a full suite of editing tools
* Capture moments on the fly with stories

Some features may not be available in your country or region. 

Terms & Policies: https://www.facebook.com/policies_center
Privacy Policy: https://www.facebook.com/privacy

Learn how we're working to help keep our communities safe across Meta technologies at the Meta Safety Center: https://about.meta.com/actions/safety
